total_revenue.context: Q4 2020 net sales increased to $125.6 billion, up 44% year-over-year. Excluding the $1.7 billion favorable impact from foreign exchange rates, net sales grew by 42% compared to Q4 2019.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had a favorable impact of $1.7 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America net sales increased to $75.346 billion, up 40% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America increased to $57.121 billion, up 55% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for North America increased to $2.946 billion in Q4 2020, compared with $1.282 billion in Q4 2019.

net_sales.context: International net sales increased to $37.467 billion, up 57% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International increased to $17.327 billion, up 28% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for International increased to $0.363 billion in Q4 2020, compared with a loss of $0.407 billion in Q4 2019.

net_sales.context: AWS net sales increased to $12.742 billion, up 28% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS increased to $8.066 billion, up 56% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for AWS increased to $3.564 billion in Q4 2020, compared with $2.261 billion in Q4 2019.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased to $96.145 billion, up 37% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses increased to $89.951 billion, up 38% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $6.194 billion in Q4 2020, compared with $3.157 billion in Q4 2019.

total_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses for Q4 2020 were $89.951 billion, up 38% from $66.824 billion in Q4 2019.
key_factors: Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

COGS.context: Cost of goods sold increased to $91 million in Q4 2020.

Fulfillment.context: Fulfillment expenses increased to $364 million in Q4 2020.

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses increased to $1.412 billion in Q4 2020.

Marketing.context: Marketing expenses increased to $476 million in Q4 2020.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses increased to $219 million in Q4 2020.

Other.context: WW shipping costs increased to $21.465 billion in Q4 2020.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense increased to $2.562 billion in Q4 2020.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income increased to $6.194 billion in Q4 2020, compared with $3.157 billion in Q4 2019.

net_income.context: Net income increased to $7.2 billion in Q4 2020, compared with $2.134 billion in Q4 2019.

eps.context: Net income of $7.2 billion translates to $14.09 per diluted share in Q4 2020, compared with $4.23 per diluted share in Q4 2019.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow increased to $31.0 billion for the trailing twelve months, up from $25.8 billion the previous year.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased 72% to $66.1 billion for the trailing twelve months.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations increased to $20.3 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $16.2 billion the previous year.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations increased to $21.4 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with $12.5 billion the previous year.

capital_expenditures.context: Invested over $10 billion in Project Kuiper, a low earth orbit satellite constellation initiative.

share_repurchase.context: Share repurchase details not provided in the provided information.

daily_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the provided information.

monthly_active_users.context: No specific user metrics provided in the provided information.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,298,000 in Q4 2020, up 63% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to lead in various sectors including e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and innovative technologies.
initiatives: Expansion of AWS regions and services
Launch of Amazon Pharmacy and Amazon Fresh grocery stores
Introduction of Made For You in Amazon Fashion
Integration of Just Walk Out technology in Hudson stores
Enhancement of Prime Video's content and live sports offerings
Launch of Amazon Halo and Luna cloud gaming service

Expand technological innovations in AI, automation, and quantum computing
Enhance customer satisfaction and service offerings
Support small and medium-sized businesses
Drive innovation in health and wellness through Amazon Halo

leadership_transition.description: Jeff Bezos, Amazon founder and CEO, will transition to the role of Executive Chair in Q3 2021, and Andy Jassy will become Chief Executive Officer at that time.
leadership_transition.context: Jeff Bezos is stepping down to focus on long-term strategic initiatives and innovation, while Andy Jassy, head of AWS, will take over as CEO to lead Amazon's continued growth.
